This is cpm.h86, with annotations. See comments in place and at
end. 6:40 PM 9/18/2003

:00000001FF


:02000085000079
:0D0A60823132206A616E7561727920383200
          1 2   j a n u a r y   8 2
:02000085000079
        ^ 85 record type is paragraph addr for absolute code [seg]
:0400000300000A806F
        ^ 03 record type is start address
 -table, bdos functions address offsets 
:1B0A8081260FAB156314B0151225FC15B515D315D815DE15EA15F115EC0A06CE

:1B0AD18121D621F821F10A570F760F800FAC0FCE0FF40F06104410A4101D0EFF

#dwa80       /-system reset                     /-get i/o byte
; :0A80  0F26 15AB 1463 15B0 2512 15FC 15B5 15D3
; :0A90  15D8 15DE 15EA 15F1 0AEC 2006 1F9D 2027
; :0AA0  20A1 20A7 20D2 20EB 20F4 20FD 2103 210C
; :0AB0  2115 211B 2121 2128 17BA 212E 2134 213D
; :0AC0  2146 2158 2161 2167 216D 2173 15F7 15F7
; :0AD0  21C4 21D6 21F8 0AF1 0F57 0F76 0F80 0FAC
; :0AE0  0FCE 0FF4 1006 1044 10A4 0E1D <-fn59 prgm load


:0B0AEC81B022E9030BBBA024E94A16ED

-Start of BDOS, first 6 bytes are s/n or control number, 0B06h is
  - the interrupt 224 entry point to the BDOS system-
:1B0B0081000A0000099A1E8CC88ED88F069D2480F905740580F90D7205C606BE

;record type 86 is for absolute data.

:00000001FF

-!!! Unknown Patch Number !!!-
-not present in release v1.1 for the PC&XT-
- the v1.1 code is the same as original record, above -
:0400000300000521D3
:03052181E91C054C

;0521 JMP    0A40

:0F0A4081803EE0243C7203E9DAFA2401E9D5FA19

;0A40 CMP    BYTE [24E0],3C ;;;[ #h3c 003C #60 '<' ]
;0A45 JB     0A4A
;0A47 JMP    0524
;0A4A AND    AL,01
;0A4C JMP    0524

:00000001FF


:180A00823132204A616E75617279203139383200000000000012018276

;0A00 this is data '12 January 1982', record type 82, this
;     ends up being patched over. see below.
; '12 january 82' found at 0A60 in release vers.
 
:00000001FF

-Patch 01, BDOS, 3/03/82-
:04000003000021E6F2
:0521E681AA0AC0740289

;21E6 STOSB
;21E7 OR     AL,AL
;21E9 JZ     21ED

:0421F1811FA20A009E

;21F1 POP    DS
;21F2 MOV    [000A],AL

:00000001FF

-Patch 11, BDOS, 5/20/82-
:0400000300000A30BF
:0F0A3081A12323A39D24C7069B24FFFFE9C704AD

;0A30 MOV    AX,[2323]  [.User_Parm_Seg]
;0A33 MOV    [249D],AX  [.Param_seg]
;0A36 MOV    WORD [249B],FFFF [.Aret]
;0A3C JMP    0F06             [Load59_ret]

:030F1E81E90FFB5C

:0F1E JMP    0A30

:00000001FF

-Patch 07, BDOS, 4/21/82-
:0400000300000B7777
:020B778133C008

;0B77 XOR    AX,AX


:00000001FF

-Patch 06, BDOS, 4/23/82-
:04000003000018964B
:041896818E06A22473

;1896 MOV    ES,[24A2]

:00000001FF

-Patch 08, BDOS, 5/12/82-
:0400000300000E23C8
:060E238106908916DC2215

;0E23 PUSH   ES
;0E24 NOP
;0E25 MOV    [22DC],DX

:040F1A81E903FB90DB

;0F1A JMP    0A20
;0F1D NOP

:050A2081A3962407C329

;0A20 MOV    [2496],AX
;0A23 POP    ES
;0A24 RET

:00000001FF

-Patch 10, BDOS, 5/20/82-
:0400000300000A509F
:0C0A50817207C7069B24FFFFC3E93B012E

;0A50 JB     0A59
;0A52 MOV    WORD [249B],FFFF
;0A58 RET
;0A59 JMP    0B97

:030B9481E9B9FE3D

;0B94 JMP    0A50

:00000001FF

-Patch 13, BDOS, 06/08/82-
:0400000300000A00EF
:1B0A00812EC606982401502E8A2627232EA0132350CDE0582EA213232E8826F0
:050A1B81272358C39060

;0A00 CS:    MOV    BYTE [2498],01
;0A06 PUSH   AX
;0A07 CS:    MOV    AH,[2327]
;0A0C CS:    MOV    AL,[2313]
;0A10 PUSH   AX
;0A11 INT    E0
;0A13 POP    AX
;0A14 CS:    MOV    [2313],AL
;0A18 CS:    MOV    [2327],AH
;0A1D POP    AX
;0A1E RET
;0A1F NOP

:090C4281E9BBFD90909090909027

;0C42 JMP    0A00
;0C45 NOP
;0C46 NOP
;0C47 NOP
;0C48 NOP
;0C49 NOP
;0C4A NOP

:00000001FF  <--end of module record
;------------------------
;eo cpm.h86 annotated, this file differs from cpm86 v1.1 in some patch 
; placement areas & coding, but the bulk of it is the same, including 
; the bdos fn vector addresses. [that is: cpm86 v1.1 for the PC&XT]
;
;   !See cpm86bug.zip for the patches from DRI!
; Not Installed: patch 15, BDOS, 11/19/82 re: The BDOS does not load
;  a file with absolute load address for EXTRA or STACK Segments.
;
;======================================
; Re: cp/m-86 for the IBM PC & XT V1.1
;
; Patch 01 -installed
; Patch 06 -installed
; Patch 07 -installed
; Patch 08 -! not installed !
; Patch 10 -! installed, but at :0A2E, vs 0A50h as here
; Patch 11 -! installed, but at :0A1F, vs 0A30h as here
; Patch 13 -installed
; Patch 15 -! not installed !
;  Add'l Patch at :09FAh
;   :09FA MOV    AL,[24A4]
;   :09FD JMP    00DA
;  Add'l Patch at :0A3Ah         [jumped to from :10A4][Fn 56 & 57]
;   :0A3A TEST   BYTE [24AF],FF
;   :0A3F JZ     0A57
;   :0A41 CMP    BYTE [2393],01
;   :0A46 JLE    0A56
;   :0A48 CALL   1133              [frcrar:]
;   :0A4B MOV    BX,[2394]
;   :0A4F CALL   1031              [fremem:]
;   :0A52 DEC    BYTE [2393]
;   :0A56 RET
;   :0A57 XOR    AX,AX
;   :0A59 MOV    [2329],AL
;   :0A5C JMP    10A9              [patch ret to inline, Fn 58]
;   ;0A5F 00h 
; [Fn58 Free All Memory, Fn 56 Alloc ABS Mem, Fn 57 Free Mem]
;------------------------
;Document Date:: 
;8:52 PM 9/18/2003 - There may be other patch areas, this document is
;  a work in progress.
;------------------------
; -EOF-
